senses.de: To scatter or spread things over a wide area
senses.ex: The crowd dispersed when the police arrived.

Tips.title: Physical Action
Tips.description: Used when objects or people are physically moving apart.
Tips.example: The demonstrators dispersed peacefully after the rally.

Tips.title: Not Disassemble
Tips.description: 'Disperse' implies spreading widely, not taking something apart.
Tips.example: The wind helped to disperse the pollen across the field.

Tips.title: Wide Area
Tips.description: The result often covers a large area, not just a slight expansion.
Tips.example: The farmer used a machine to disperse the fertilizer evenly over the crop.

senses.de: To go or cause to go in different directions
senses.ex: After the meeting, we all dispersed to our homes.

Tips.title: Different Directions
Tips.description: Focuses on the movement of going away from a common point.
Tips.example: The participants dispersed into the city to complete the scavenger hunt.

Tips.title: After an Event
Tips.description: Often used at the end of an event or gathering.
Tips.example: Guests started to disperse once the wedding reception ended.

senses.de: To disappear or cause to disappear
senses.ex: The morning fog will disperse as the day goes on.

Tips.title: Gradual Disappearance
Tips.description: Implies a slow fading away until no longer visible or present.
Tips.example: The sun emerged as the clouds began to disperse.

Tips.title: Not Instant
Tips.description: Disappearing through dispersal takes time, not immediate.
Tips.example: Smoke from the fireworks dispersed slowly into the night sky.

Diffuse.wordDefinition:
The words diffuse and disperse are both related to spreading out. Diffuse means to spread something out over a large area or to make something less concentrated.

It is applicable when you want to describe something spreading evenly in different directions, like the fragrance of perfume, which can be diffused evenly throughout a room.

Diffuse is about spreading something evenly, while disperse is about scattering something in different directions.

Dispel.wordDefinition:
"Dispelling" refers to making something go away, especially a notion or a myth. It means to dissuade a concern or misunderstanding, generally through clarification and confirmation of the true facts.

"Dispelling" refers to getting rid of something negative or harmful, while disperse refers to spreading out something that is usually beneficial.

Disseminate.wordDefinition:
Disseminate means to spread information or knowledge widely.

This word is commonly used when referring to spreading ideas, such as disseminating news or disseminating scientific research.

Disperse is used when talking about physical objects spreading out, while disseminate is used to talk about ideas or information spreading out.

Dissipate.wordDefinition:
Disperse means to scatter or spread out in different directions, while dissipate means to gradually disappear or disperse entirely.

Dissipate is often used when referring to things like energy or heat that gradually fade away, like the steam dissipating from a cup of hot tea.

Both words can be used interchangeably in certain contexts, but generally disperse is more commonly used when referring to physical dispersion, while dissipate is used when referring to the gradual disappearance of something.

Distribute.wordDefinition:
Distribute means to give out or deliver something, usually in an organized or deliberate way. It's often used when talking about giving things like food, supplies, or information to people who need them.

For example, a charity might distribute food to people who are hungry.

The difference between the two is that disperse is about things moving away from each other while distribute is about things being given out to others.

Scatter.wordDefinition:
Disperse and scatter are two verbs that are often used interchangeably to describe objects or people moving away from a central location.

Scatter generally means to throw or spread objects or people in different directions. It implies a forceful or chaotic movement, as if something is being thrown in every direction without any specific order.

For example, a teacher might scatter some candies around the classroom to reward their students.

Scatter is used when objects or people are thrown in different directions suddenly, while disperse is used when things gradually move away from each other in a controlled way.

Sow.wordDefinition:
Disperse means to spread out or scatter in different directions, while the word sow means to plant seeds in or on the ground.

Sow is usually applicable when talking about planting seeds in soil.

Spread.wordDefinition:
Spread means to extend or distribute over an area or surface. For example, butter being spread on toast or a wildfire spreading across a forest.

Spread is applicable when referring to objects or substances extending over a surface or area.

Disperse is used when referring to the scattering of objects or people, while spread is used when referring to objects or substances extending over a surface or area.

Strew.wordDefinition:
Strew means to scatter or spread out in a random or haphazard way, as in strewing flower petals on a path or strewing toys around a room.

Disperse is used when you want to describe something being spread out over a wide area or group, while strew is used when you want to describe something being scattered or spread out in a more random or haphazard way.

quotes.Text: An honest politician has no goodies to toss around. This limits his effectiveness profoundly, because political power in India is dispersed throughout a multi-tiered federal structure; a local official who has not been paid off can sometimes stop a billion-dollar project.
quotes.Title: Indian Writer
quotes.Name: Aravind Adiga

quotes.Text: Diplomacy in a sense is the opposite of writing. You have to disperse yourself so much: the lady who comes in crying because she's had a fight with the secretary; exports and imports; students in trouble; thumbtacks for the embassy.
quotes.Title: Mexican Novelist
quotes.Name: Carlos Fuentes

quotes.Text: It is clearly a political move to remove 8chan from Cloudflare. It has forced a lot of people to find other places to talk. It has dispersed a peacefully assembled group of people talking. This silenced them effectively.
quotes.Title: American Businessman
quotes.Name: Jim Watkins

quotes.Text: For me, the real earth is that chosen part of the universe, still almost universally dispersed and in course of gradual segregation, but which is little by little taking on body and form in Christ.
quotes.Title: French Philosopher
quotes.Name: Pierre Teilhard de Chardin

quotes.Text: But we must not, if we are loyal, disperse our energies in a partisan warfare that is waged without regard to its consequences to the well being, security, or honor of the country.
quotes.Title: American Public Servant
quotes.Name: Bainbridge Colby

quotes.Text: I don't think of myself as a maverick at all. Quite the opposite - I really think of myself as quite conventional but dispersed over unusual territory.
quotes.Title: English Musician
quotes.Name: Richard Coles

quotes.Text: All the information in the world has been pretty dispersed, but Google's mission has been to organize it and make it universally accessible.
quotes.Title: American Businessman
quotes.Name: Bill Maris

quotes.Text: Pollution is nothing but the resources we are not harvesting. We allow them to disperse because we've been ignorant of their value.
quotes.Title: American Inventor
quotes.Name: R. Buckminster Fuller

quotes.Text: In a world of dispersed authority, the battle for the truth will be won or lost with the employees.
quotes.Title: American Businessman
quotes.Name: Richard Edelman

quotes.Text: Exhibitions usually are not collected; they disperse after they take place.
quotes.Title: Swiss Critic
quotes.Name: Hans-Ulrich Obrist
